required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Assess the Efficacy of the VEGFR-FGFR Inhibitor, Lucitanib, Given to Patients With FGFR1-driven Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Arm, Open-label, Phase II Study to Assess the Efficacy of the Dual VEGFR-FGFR Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor, Lucitanib, Given Orally as a Single Agent to Patients With FGFR1-driven Lung Cancer

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether lucitanib is effective in the treatment of patients with FGFR1 amplified squamous non-small cell lung cancer.

detailed_description.textblock:
Lucitanib is an oral inhibitor of the tyrosine kinase activity of FGFR 1/2 and VEGFR 1-3. Lucitanib has demonstrated potent antitumour and antiangiogenic activity in several preclinical models of cancer, including a human lung cancer model (H1581) which harbors FGFR1 amplification.
The first in human trial of lucitanib demonstrated that 15 mg of lucitanib given daily, can provide durable clinical responses in cancer patients with alterations of the FGF pathway. Based on these results, lucitanib is being studied in FGFR1 amplified squamous non-small cell lung cancer.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, every 8 weeks; up to 2 years
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients in whom a confirmed Complete Response (CR) or a confirmed Partial Response (PR), as best overall response according to RECIST criteria, is observed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, every 8 weeks; up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients in whom a confirmed CR or confirmed PR or a prolonged Stable Disease (SD) (â‰¥ 6 months), as best overall response according to RECIST, is observed

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, every 8 weeks; up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the date of first drug intake until the date of progression or death for any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, every 8 weeks; up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: For responders (i.e. patients with best overall response CR or PR), the interval from the time of first documentation of response to the date of progression or death for any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, every 8 weeks; up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: For responders and patients with SD as best overall response, time from the first drug intake until the date of progression or death for any cause
From the date of first drug intake to the date of death for any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening, every 8 weeks; up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Will be evaluated using the following criteria: The tumour size defined as the sum of the largest diameters of target lesions The tumour volume The Tumour Growth rate defined as an increase in tumour volume during 1 month

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse events (AEs), clinical laboratory abnormalities, and dose modifications

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 14 and 28, Cycle 2 Day 56, Cycle 3 Day 84

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacogenomic approach of inter-patients variation in gene encoding ADME involved proteins

secondary_outcome.description: Soluble growth factors and other biomarkers, including circulating tumour DNA

arm_group.description: Lucitanib given orally once daily on a continuous schedule. Starting dose 15 mg/day

intervention.description: Lucitanib given orally to all patients. once daily (q.d.), on a continuous schedule over 28-day cycles, in fasting conditions (at least 2 hours prior and 2 hours after any meal), until progressive disease or unacceptable toxicity. Starting dose is 15 mg/day and can be reduced at 2.5 mg steps till 7.5 mg/day based on individual tolerability.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically confirmed stage IV squamous NSCLC
- FGFR1-amplification determined on the most recent archive sample available or on a newly performed biopsy
- Availability of a tissue sample suitable for the central confirmation by FISH of FGFR1 amplification
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) of 0 or 1
- Measurable disease per RECIST 1.1
- At least one prior treatment line in the advanced-metastatic setting
- Ability to take oral medication
Exclusion Criteria:
- Symptomatic and/or untreated central nervous system metastases
- Presence of another active cancer
- Biologic therapy, chemotherapy, radiation, or surgery within 4 weeks of the first dose of Lucitanib
